text:
Oh my sugar library is becoming more and more glorious by the day
```struct A
    name; age
end
greet(a::A) = println("Hello, my name is $(a.name)")
can_own_home(a::A) = a.age > 18
struct B
    name;age;country
end
attach"A -> B"
casey = B("Casey",99,"USA")
greet(casey)
"Hello, my name is Casey"```
Is this neccessary? No. Is it fun. Yes.

elements.text: Oh my sugar library is becoming more and more glorious by the day

struct A
    name; age
end
greet(a::A) = println("Hello, my name is $(a.name)")
can_own_home(a::A) = a.age > 18
struct B
    name;age;country
end
attach"A -> B"
casey = B("Casey",99,"USA")
greet(casey)
"Hello, my name is Casey"
Is this neccessary? No. Is it fun. Yes.

text: Does attach need to be a string macro? Wouldn't a regular macro be better? it gives you parsing for free

elements.text: Does attach need to be a string macro? Wouldn't a regular macro be better? it gives you parsing for free

text: I couldn't figure out how to do it. I think the normal macro requires the code to be "feasible" julia code. doesn't need to have the arrow though... :stuck_out_tongue: Okay I could make it more normal
